Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: janrhian
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Barcelona don't come cheap - especially if you want a central location as we did. Plaza Catalunya is at the heart of the city and we were a short stroll away from the charming Gothic area, just by the tourist bus stops and with a line of taxis near by (useful as we had quite a bit of rain). We arrived very late and were welcomed warmly with a glass of cava and taken to our rooms, both of which had small balconies and overlooked the Plaza. Comments have been made about the hard beds but we slept well -personally,I hate soft squishy mattresses, though the castors on the beds do have a tendency to cause the beds to roam. Breakfast was ample and varied -fresh fruit, cooked eggs, cereals, cold cuts, breads and pastries - enough to keep us topped up till lunch. We'd certainly stay here again -and will definitely re-visit Barcelona. so much to see and do -even in the rain!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ferenc D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the best place in Barcelona. Service and breakfast excellent. The walls are a little bit too thin. Foreign movement on the corridors can be disturbing. The price in EU comparison not cheap, but in the end worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterPro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the rooms with a patio. The rooms are clean and modern looking. En suite bath, safe in room, etc. Location is nice, right on the square. Aerobus from the airport drops off across the square from this hotel and the hop on hop off bus tours start right in front of the hotel. Its right at the top of the Ramblas, and walking distance to all sorts of neat stuff. The metro is at the end of the block and you can easily get anywhere in the city from here. Beds are a little hard for my taste. It was a superb location for pre/post cruise accommodation. Close to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ellybob
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a 3 night city break to Barcelona. This hotel came highly recommended by a friend. As soon as we stepped off the aerobus at Catalunya plaza the hotel was hard to miss with its pink painted frontage! After quick check-in and very friendly reception staff we headed off to our double room with terrace on the first floor. Everything in order - very clean, quite spacious with a sitting area even had a kettle, cups & tea/coffee. A nice little touch was the "welcome buffet" which is served on the first floor lounge area each day between 2pm & 10pm. Breakfast served in beautiful dining room overlooking the square. Good selection of cereals, fruit, juices, eggs, toast etc, etc. Regarding the location you just step out of the hotel, turn right and you are 2 minutes walk from The Triangle Shopping Centre and Las Ramblas, further along is the port/harbour area. The tour buses, aerobuses and taxis all line the square and the metro line literally a few steps away from the hotel entrance. Why have I only reviewed at very good and not excellent? We heard our neighbours slamming doors and being generally discourteous and noisy late at night (I know this is not the hotel's fault and maybe we should have reported it); If going to Barcelona I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “'Most uncomfortable beds ever & deafening!'”
Reviews.Author: Suelovesbarcelo... I
Reviews.Content: March 2012 The location & view from mini balcony is hard to beat BUT be warned total exhaustion is the price you will pay. The beds are unbelievably uncomfortable with no 'give' at all for 2 of us who like soft/hard matresses & one of us who can normally sleep anywhere & yes they do roll around the room. The hotel did 'line' the bed with a blanket on request after 2 nights of severe sleep deprevation but don't wait as long as we did, ask up front. Oh & also this stunning location is deafening, the equivalent of sleeping on Marble Arch as traffic & people fill this square almost 24/7.Now you know & will be prepared so enjoy this fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find a better location!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere07
Reviews.Content: Contemporary design, typical European cardboard mattress, excellent service - impossible to beat the location. For Canadians who are likely to get robbed on Plaza Catalunya, you're in luck - the Consulate is on the plaza, a few steps from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Coutts88
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is its central location. We were really disappointed after reading all the good reviews. Booked a triple room which was tiny, beds were on wheels and everytime you moved, the bed moved. Rooms are very tired and could do with renovation. Bathroom door did not close. Only a 5min walk from the George Payne Irish bar, well worth a visit. Would certainly not stay at this hotel again if Returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RMDHCZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and very clean and perfect service. They have to improve the service during breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Location”
Reviews.Author: Gail G
Reviews.Content: Great location, so convenient for all. Can catch aerobus from airport to Plaza Catalunya and the hotel is on one corner. Very easy. Main Tourist info centre is on the plaza for all your needs. Tourist buses and local buses and metro leave from Plaza. Walk to most attractions possible. Hotel has block out curtains and double windows so noise and light are not a problem from busy square. Put in request for double or twin beds as double room doesn't guarantee double. Free wi fi, tea/coffee and snacks between 2-10pm is great. Some rooms bigger than others. Not huge but comfortable. Clean and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accomodation Ok”
Reviews.Author: StefUS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right on Plaza Catalunya so smack in the heart of Barcelona. Lobby inexistant, but the 'guest' areas and room were very nice. Breakfast also very hearty. We booked a balcony room and expected a high floor, but instead these rooms are on the first floor. Nice patio but not much privacy as other buildings surrounding. Room nice, right size. Bathroom clean and 'new' but very, very small. A bit undecided if I'd return, considering the price. Overall nice, in the average.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaBcn
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for a night so I could attend an xmas work party as I live outside BCN. I was pleasantly surprised, as for the very reasonable price I payed I was expecting a dive. The H10 Catalunya is right on Plaça Catalunya, my room had a direct view of the beautiful Christmas lights and it was really enchanting. You are right in the middle of town, with Metro and Train station at your doorstep, next to all the sights and walking distance to all the best restaurants. This is a much better and safer option than staying on the Ramblas, which is dangerous for tourists and quite frankly pretty grubby. Staff were very nice, the room was very clean with comfy bed. Lots of complementary toiletries and a mini bar. Did not try the breakfast, so cannot comment. The building itself is beautifully restored with lots of original features, which is a nice change from bland purpose-built hotels. I would definitely recommend this place, fantastic value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, strange smells”
Reviews.Author: MisterFeedback
Reviews.Content: simply can not beat the location if you are a tourist. Rooms are small, customer service is limited, free internet access on 2nd or 3rd floor. Nasty smells in lobby area (sewer smells). Lasted the entire weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tomnprue
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel primarily for it's location. The aerobus from the airport was within 100 metres, the underground station, the famous Las Ramblas and the hop on hop off tourist bus were also at our doorstep; not to mention the department store - El Corte Ingles - across the square. It was fantastic so convenient. Our room was situated at the back of the hotel which was nice and quiet. I had read other reviews saying that the hotel was noisy but our room was fine. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel does not have a large lounge area and the internet was very slow, however we mainly spent time at our hotel to sleep and eat breakfast so it suited us. There is so much to do and see in Barcelona rather than waste time in your hotel. For those that use it, the lounge area provides free tea, coffee, sandwiches & pastries which is great when you return home after a long day out. Would go back there again, the convenience of the location is it's best feature.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Shawna80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night after a 9 day cruise in Barcelona. First off, it was unfortunate that we were let off the ship at 7 am on a Sunday morning. We took a taxi from the cruise terminal to the hotel, but they wouldn't let us check in until 1 pm (which is a standard policy that I am aware of - however I had e-mailed a few days in advance letting them know about our plight and asking for an early check-in. It was not to be, but oh well). Our biggest issue was the room. We had no idea that it would be twin beds in a tiny room (and I mean tiny - our stateroom on the ship was a mansion compared to this room) and that our small window would look out into an alley with some sort of screen keeping us from seeing the sky. One of my biggest concerns was the risk of fire - there was no way out of our room except down the stairs or down the ancient elevator. The toilet would not flush properly, and we never were able to get the TV to work. I understand that a lot of people don't come to Barcelona to relax in their hotel room, but if you are anything like me, you need a moment away from the crowds from time to time. (Oh, and crowds in September...Be very prepared for these). Overall, our room cost about $345 US, and I felt it was a pretty poor value compared to the Eurostars Grand Marina, where we spent the night before our cruise. (We were not able to get the same hotel for two different nights due to how busy the city was at the time we visited). Overall Barcelona is a great city, but if you aren't crazy about crowds, I would recommend going in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, big rooms, near gay district”
Reviews.Author: lesbrown1974
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that's been updated with modern bathrooms and great views of the Catalunya Plaza. It's situated at the top of the Ramblas, just East of the Eixample, within walking distance of great shops, the Ramblas, nice and very nice restaurants, and just about anything you might need. The rooms have two twin beds pushed together into a king sized formation, but one of the beds can be rolled away. We had a little trouble figuring out the A/C system (the control isn't marked and there are no instructions) and were cold the first night! It works well, though! Rooms on the front of the hotel have small balconies and huge windows that open double wide, which is great when the temperature is nice outside. With the windows closed there was surprisingly little noise, and the curtains did a great job blocking out light. There's a 2.5 euro deposit per day to use the room safe, but they refund it when you turn back in the key. Breakfast was included, and was a pretty standard set of breads, meat, pastries, cheese, and juices, as well as cereal, yougurt and such. The hotel elevator is small and pretty slow, and the guest rooms are on the 3rd floor (counting ground floor as 1) and higher, so you'll be climbing some stairs unless you're willing to wait a bit. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and spoke english very well. They offered a number of recommendations on restaurants close by, and tapas bars. They required a copy of our passports (for everyone staying in the room?) for some reason, which they didn't explain, and was kind of pain during check-in since we were arriving by car and hadn't needed them in several days. The room we had, front of the building, had 2 stairs going down from the hall, so if you need accessible rooms, make sure you specify that. The room had TV, a safe (note deposit required), refrigerator, big closet, full bath plus bidet, and was nicely appointed. While a little more expensive than some hotels in the same chain, the location was great for what we wanted to see. There is a metro stop right outside the front Door (Plaza Catalunya), with connections to Sagrada Familia, Parc Gruell, etc.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT BEST POSITION”
Reviews.Author: cgfromperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter and my friend for 3 nights. Great room 3 single beds yahoo!!. Hard to get previous hotels had double and 1 single so we were very grateful. Location is awesome so close to everything.Very clean and aerobus only 50 meters across the square. Breakfast was excellent and free coffee and pastries available in the afternoons. Free Wifi, fridge and coffee facilities in the room. You couldnt ask for a better hotel. We were very impressed and enjoyed our stay. Was a little small for 3 people but we were not in the room too much in the day time so it didnt really matter. Overall I would definately recommend to stay here and would choose to stay again on my return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: esteban95
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel is situated on Plaza Catalunya in the center of Barcelona, two steps from Plz Cataluna, Las Ramblas, Passeig deGracia, etc. It has a nice old entrance lobby and main stairs. Stylish rooms include a flat-screen TV . Airco individual and very silent. Safe, free. Excellent location. Breakfast in a great salon was very good and complete . The bathroom was very clean and spacious. The triple room was very confortable and the third bed was separated from the double bed by a furniture/placard , so that the room gives the view of two different areas. I must say that I highly recommend the hotel. (July 2011, Eu 188 per day including breakfast )

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: Shaaron2217
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel isn't as spacious as the photos on their website depict,, we found this a great place to stay. Their location is right on Catalunya Plaza and you can walk to so many wonderful places, including the Mediterranean. The staff was pleasant and the rooms were clean. If you needed transportation, everything is right out their front doors. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and would recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen040
Reviews.Content: One night pre cruise stay at this hotel. Took bus from Barcelona airport and hotel opposite bus stop so found no problem. Had two rooms booked, double and triple. Both were good, the triple had sun terrace with furniture and plenty room for my husband, daughter aged 9 and myself. Parents room also big enough for them. Large bathroom with lots of complimentary toiletries. Breakfast buffet very nice. Staff friendly and overall hotel very clean. Got a great deal here through Octopus Travel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend- we will be back”
Reviews.Author: IandD46
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff friendly and helpful, room comfortable and clean. very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing - beware some rooms have no windows”
Reviews.Author: chrisaust
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good enough location, but sadly it was let down by the rooms. We were given a room on a split level room , that is between two floors, it was down a narrow corridor with no window, only a blanked out shutter that opened into a machinery area. As a result the room was very dark and claustaphobic and you could not tell night from day. It felt like a box. The room furnishing was OK , new with laminate flooring, it had a decent bathroom but small. We did not use any of the other hotel facilities the breakfast was way over priced, we only stayed two nights which was more than enough for Barcelona. It is quite noisey and busy around the hotel and there are big groups of 18 - 19 year olds on tour groups wandering around the area, so if your after a peacefull stay this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: hoorayfarray
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location makes up for a bit more rundown hotel than I was expecting. But the value was great for the location. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were small but clean and comfortable. And let's be honest --- you only sleep there. The rest of the time you are out exploring the city. I would recommend the hotel with the caveat to manage your expectations. You are selecting the hotel for the location --- not the room size and 4-star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: JennyEngland
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a week. The hotel is very central, clean and comfortable with wonderful, silent air conditioning. We had a front facing room with twin beds, wonderful for people watching from the balcony although it could be quite lively out in the Plaza at night but the doors shut out most of the noise. The breakfast was more than adequate to fill up on for the day but if what you wanted was gone it wasn't replenished very quickly. Free snacks, Cava and beverages were very welcome and allowed you to skip lunch. The staff were very helpful, a special mention for Guiseppe at the reception desk, very cheerful (and handsome) and always ready to direct us to wherever. Despite all the warnings we recieved about the dangers of Barcelona we didn't feel intimidated once but do be aware that the fake goods sellers are all around the Plaza. Haggle and get a real bargain or avert your eyes. We took the Julia travel trip to Montserrat and were disappointed to have very little time there, it is not a full day tour which we'd expected for the price. Not enough time there to see everything although we didn't find a viable alternative to get there. We also got two day tickets for the bus tour and managed to get to everywhere in Barcelona that we wanted to see on it. Great to just sit atop in the evenings too to chill out and cool off. If I were in Barcelona again I would be happy to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: cptrita
Reviews.Content: Quite comfortable & perfect location ---front desk staff was VERY helpful !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sunny Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SignoraL
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time here. The staff were great and the location was very central to the main sights and restaurants. We had originally booked at the sister hotel up the road but there was a problem with the booking. Everything was resolved very well with no problems and the hotel honored the cost of our original booking which was cheaper. They even threw in breakfast to apologise for the inconvenience. Classy.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, and we'll be back for a third!”
Reviews.Author: Westpassage
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the H10. It's location on Plaza Catalunya is perfect. The Aerobus is just across the Plaza and at just over €9 return is great value & convenient. The hotel is spotless, including the bathrooms. Free wifi in bedrooms is a huge benefit, with 2 computers freely available for residents in the lounge on 1st floor 24/7, with free tea/coffee, cava/water, croissants, etc. from 2-10pm which I have never seen in any other hotel. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but just beside the hotel is a little cafe with coffee & croissant for €1.85 and much more too. Excellent value considering the location. Only a few minutes walk from the market on La Rambla if you fancy some really fresh fruit/juices. Our first stay here we stayed in a Plaza facing room with balcony, but the trees were as tall as the balcony totally obstructing the view! Room was small, but had everything necessary and spotless. Wouldn't recommend it for kids. This stay we opted for a room with a patio, chairs, table, etc. This was located at the back of the hotel. No view except the backs of buildings, but very quiet. Much larger room, & still spotlessly clean, towels changed daily, tea/coffee in room. Bed was very large & very comfy. Safe available for€2.50 per day. With such a great location, you don't spend much time in the room anyway, so view not important. Location is precious. We didn't have a car as everything is just outside the door - literally! The Hop on-Hop off bus, the Aerobus, restaurants, La Rambla, Gaudi houses Casa Battlo & Casa Mila, lots of shops, all withing a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: fgayer
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! In the heart of this incredible city this hotel is located near the best atractions of Barcelona, and there is a metro station in front of. The hotel is a three star seeming a four star. Good staff, large room, comfortable bed, everything very clean and a good breakfast. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in busy square”
Reviews.Author: AmyParker
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently came back from an eight night stay in Barcelona. This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who stayed there before going on a cruise. I loved the staff, who made great recommendations on tapas bars (and what to order) and what metro lines to take to get to certain venues. I have been to other European cities before, so I am aware of the smaller rooms. However, these rooms were very small. Our room was on their third floor (the fifth floor to Americans) overlooking the Placa de Catalunya. Once I adjusted to the size and the beds being on the hardside, we were fine. The breakfast every morning was great. I enjoyed the fresh pastries, fruit, and juice. The free wifi and internet access was invaluable. There are three metro stops, several bus stops, the aerobus, taxis all right outside the hotel. I wish I could take this hotel and move it to a quiet street off the Passeig de Gracia or the Rambla de Catalunya. Otherwise, we enjoyed the hotel for its location, staff, and convenience to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, the best location”
Reviews.Author: sgyuris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It cannot have a better location. Catalunya Plaza, the train and bus stations are right across the street. Ramblas blvd. , designer stores and tons of wonderful restaurants are within a walking distance. Most of them offer a great variety of Tapas/Montaditas that are delicious. The station of the tour bus, that takes you around the city, is right across the street. Service is excellent, the front desk employees run the extra mile if necessary to help you. Jousephe, Ila, David and Carolina are wonderful. Always ready to answer questions and to give you advice. The lobby, which is located on the second floor, has wine and pastries from 2 to 9 p.m. (all you want to drink and eat). Breakfast is great. For about 14 Euros you get all you can eat fruits, eggs, ham, pastries, toast, cheeses,coffe, tea, seasonal fruit juices, etc. The room was comfy however it was small. They have free Wifi 24 hours. Also, on the lobby, there are two computers available for guests 24 hours. I highly recommend this place, it is close to everything and we always felt safe in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsduffel
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 night stay at the Catalunya Plaza hotel, we arrived quite late at night and were given a small room with the promise of a Square veiw room the next day, it was well worth the wait! The room had a fantastic veiw over Catalunya Square with a small balcony and french doors. We took advantage of the free cava by enjoying a complimentery glass at lunchtime in between sightseeing and shopping both of which were right on our doorstep. The airport bus stopped across the square as did the sightseeing bus so nothing was too far. This was great as I had taken my mum who is 79 and had a lovely time. Breakfast was a mix of hot and cold but we only had the cold option, plentiful fruit, cheese, bread and pastries all served in a lovely breakfast room. The hotel staff were lovely especially Carolina who was on every day of our stay and was so friendly and helpful. l would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, friendly hotel in an excellant location.

Reviews.Title: “great location,but that's it!!!”
Reviews.Author: hajbod
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, close to all the main sights, and access to the metro, buses, airport shuttle etc.But, that's where it ends for me.We booked a double room, directly with the hotel,but when we arrived, were given a room with twin beds.The beds were on wheels and moved around.The room was small ,but had everything one would require,sufficient packing space, tea ,coffee etc.The bathtub leaked and the floor was constantly wet.the toiletries were not replaced...1 small bar of soap for 4 days!!!!The lift did not work for our last 2 nights there, and we told by a very surly young lady at reception"not working"!that's it..no apology!The building was very noisy.Breakfast was very standard,the same boring fare each day!We did not enjoy the hotel stay and will certainly NOT stay here again.We love Barcelona and will return, but not to H10.We certainly did not get value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel not so”
Reviews.Author: summerstaffs Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect & I think that's what made up for it being so average. When we checked in they gave us a twin room, which is not what I booked.When my partner went to reception to tell them we had booked a double the person on the desk told him the booking company had informed them we booked a twin & they had no doubles left. When my partner produced our booking confirmation which showed a double, the guy started getting quite abrupt - not great customer service! They made our beds up together & told us we should speak to the manager the next day. One plus was that the breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STEVENSNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at two separate times at H10 Plaza within one week. My first stay was for 2 nights right after Thanksgiving. I got a great rate for a single room that included a good breakfast as well. The room was on 4th floor (top) and was literally the smallest room I have ever been in! It did have everything you could need, including wifi and was fine for sleeping, but little else. The staff was wonderful and the location was close enough to walk to everything but not in the mix of the noise, etc. I transferred to another Hotel for business after 2 days then missed my return flight and went back to H10 for 2 more nights before my next flight. I chose H10 for the location and especially the value. I hoped I would get a larger room and I was lucky enough to be set up in a double room which was considerably bigger and very comfortable. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good, convenient location and excellent value. Being from the USA and converting USD to Euros, I was particularly aware of the exchange rate and how much more everything cost me. My average cost at H10 was lower than similar hotels in the area. There was also a great convenience to being less than a block or two from the Airport bus, which was the best bargain in town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: solfre
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to a romantic weekend in Barcelona and paid an average of Euro 140 for what we thought would be a standard room. It turned out to be a single room with an extra bed - about 8 m2 and the first one they offered us was even without a window that could open..... We did not get value for our money, the reception staff was not only rude, they lied us in the faces. We had the opportunity to see 2 other rooms of quite another standard, but they kept maintaining that we had been offered a standard double room, which was very obvious we hadn't when examining the evacuation plans on several floors. We had booked through Hotels.com but they turned out to be useless and kept talking about a missing bidet, for which they would offer us 40 Euro in compensation. We would have thought that the impact of Hotels.com could have helped us get a more reasonable compensation but they were not to be moved despite photo documentation. They could very easily have noted on their website that some of the rooms were very tiny and that the price reflected that. The surroundings were great as was Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room on record!”
Reviews.Author: Racing_lady
Reviews.Content: Only good thing is the location - bus from airport on other side of Plaza Catalunya which is great....thats it in terms of good points. Room extremely tiny, just enough room for 2 single beds, 1 locker a small bathroom and a table with a TV!!! Breakfast un-inviting and rude staff, There are plenty better hotels in the area at a better value and standard.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good sleep, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ksw123
Reviews.Content: The room is nothing fancy- could hardly get around the bed, but the bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. There is a deck off the room which gives a little more room. The shower is VERY small, but there is a window in the bathroom. The best part about this hotel- location is great! Right across the plaza from the airport bus drop off spot and close to everything. The breakfast is in a beautiful room and the food was delicious and very reasonable compared to other hotels we stayed in during our stay in Spain. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: schneefloeckli
Reviews.Content: The H10 Catalunya Plaza is located, as the name indicates, right at Catalunya Plaza and Las Ramblas. The staff was very friendly, the room small but clean and the parking underground - right under Catalunya Plaza in fact. The location is also great if you wish to do some touristy stuff as the hop-on-hop-off buses stop right in front of it. It was a bit problematic to find something to eat at night if you don't wish to eat fish or tapas, but otherwise, it was perfect. The only thing we found problematic was that the room got crazy cold at night and we had to get up and actually look for a woolen blanket in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem of a hotel in the middle of the Plaza”
Reviews.Author: loricsea15009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Catalunya Plaza for 4 nights pre and post cruise out of Barcelona. We absolutely loved the place. This was our first trip to Spain. The hotel is in the middle of the plaza and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, but really small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ShadowTiger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is facing Catalunya Plaza, an awesome location. It was nice and clean enough but my room, a single, was incredibly small - easily the smallest I've stayed in anywhere in Europe or the US (including New York). There was a double-sized bed with about 1 or 2 feet of space around it, a little more at the foot, and that's it. There was a desk, but not enough room for a chair, and a little too far away from the bed to sit on the bed and use it. The air conditioning was pretty weak but not bad. I did not like that the air conditioning would shut off when I wasn't in the room - that meant every day when I got back after being out in the heat the room was hot and I had to wait an hour or so for it to cool back down. Other hotels with the key feature turn off the lights and so on but leave the A/C on. (It would even be okay if it stayed on but at a higher temperature.) The bathroom was fine - wish it had more counter space but it was acceptable. Everything was in working order and space wasn't an issue in there. Breakfast - can't remember if it was included or if I paid for it - was pretty good. The eggs were not very good at all but everything else was excellent. If I paid for it I can't remember how much so I can't say if it was worth it, but on another trip I spent 7 euros just for coffee and pastries, so I'd say anything in the 10-15 euro range would be perfectly acceptable. Staff was generally good. Stayed in a room facing the back alley, so not much of a view (in fact, kept window blinds closed because easy view into my room) but on the other hand, there was practically no noise even in the busy location. The only exception was at 6 or 7 am when I could hear whistle blowing (you know the kind down the Rambla) that woke me up. But heck it was time to get up anyhow. Internet connection was good, pretty standard for the area. If you don't mind the small rooms and don't need the room to be very cool (I do, it's personal taste I guess), then I'd recommend this hotel. Otherwise, there are several other within a block or three in the same price range with bigger rooms, better A/C, and so on. The hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better but room was ultra mini”
Reviews.Author: bhuchar
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel is all about location. Its on Catalunya Plaza. On New Year's eve we could enjoy the scene at the Plaza from the hotel first floor balcony. The Las Ramblas is just next door and so is the metro station. There is also a bus stop from where you can catch a direct bus to the Airport (comfortable and economical). The pity was that we got a really, really small room. It was extremely claustrophobic. For tall people, there is no way one can sleep comfortably. But the hotel staff couldn't / didn't help out. On New Year's eve though, the staff was very helpful and let us use the 1st floor balcony overlooking the Plaza. The city gathers here to celebrate New Year. People basically get drunk and eat grapes to ring in the new year. Bottomline, only stay here if you can be guaranteed that the room is not extremely small!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice -- but no breakfast on weekends!”
Reviews.Author: MJPizzuto
Reviews.Content: Our room was spotlessly clean, a little tight quarters, but we did have a private outdoor area for our room at the back of the hotel. It had a lift, which we appreciated, was very quiet and the staff was excellent. It could not have been in a more convenient location to the plaza, the Ramlas, the busses to the airport and tour busses, also the nearby grocery store. It had everything you could want right there. The disapointment was that breakfast was not available at the hotel on weekends. What you are paying for here is the location, the extreme cleanliness of the hotel, and the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Credo505
Reviews.Content: Everything is convenient to this hotel. The airport bus stops on the other side of the square, the metro and tourist buses are right outside. Access to all the sights, main streets and restaurants is superb. Our room was at the back and small but quiet. There was free internet on the second floor accompanied by free coffee and pastries. we didn't plan to have breakfast there but the large buffet at E8 was as good if not better value than anywhere else we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: BRYNSI
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated on the Plaza de Catalunya, at the top of the Ramblas. The Hotel is perfect for the bus shuttle from the Airport, which drops you off at the other end of Plaza de Catalunya, which gives you a couple of minutes walk to the Hotel Entrance. The Hotel has many restaurants and amenities surrounding it, five minutes walk and you are in Las Ramblas, which is the most lively part of Barcelona of an evening for eating and drinking. The Gaudi Buildings are all very close by, as is a Metro station, just outside the Hotel entrance. The open top tourist buses park close to the Hotel, which is an added bonus. The Hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating, their English is perfect. The Hotel is very clean and well maintained. The price per room per night may seem expensive, but then again all Barcelona Hotels are rather expensive. Our room was to the rear of the building, it was very large and also had a large lounge area off of the main bedroom, the view from the window overlooked the garden terrace and a swimming pool from another hotel, however, our travel companions, who had a room at the front, had a much smaller room than ours with no lounge annexe. Having spoken to other guests, it would appear that the size and style of rooms greatly vary. One pair of guests had the same size of room as ours with a large balcony with seating upon it. It would just be a case of luck, as to the size of room you get. Breakfast was great and plentiful. The only criticism of the Hotel was the speed of their Internet, which was so bad, we gave up trying to use it. Overall, great Hotel in a perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: lizzzy18
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Great Staff. Excellent base. Very clean and well looked after. It does exactly what it says on the tin for Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: United_Chick
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! It's extremely close to shopping and awesome restaurants (though the one directly next to the hotel, Cafe Catalunya, was ridiculously convenient). The metro is right across the street, but you can walk to the famous shopping areas (Passeig de Gracia and Portal d'Angel), some of Gaudi's architecture, La Rambla, and Port Olimpic. The staff was professional and we couldn't have asked for more. The room was fairly large, especially by European standards. It was very clean, if a little basic. However, it was comfortable and we didn't really need anything more. With such a great location, how much time will you spend in the room anyway? Only a few odd little issues, though they weren't really problems. There was a drop ceiling, like in offices. Also, turning the TV on required a lot of button mashing, but I assure you it does turn on. Overall, great value and location with fairly nice rooms. I'd stay there again and recommend it to others, especially budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “If location matters and you're on a budget, stay here”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBear464
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on Plaza de Catalunya, right at the top of Las Ramblas and just down the road from lots of top Gaudi Buildings. This is also where the airport bus drops you off and there is a metro station right outside. As far as location goes, it is perfect. The rooms are relatively small but comfortable enough. Not the quietest room I've ever stayed in, but certainly not the noisiest. The staff are as friendly as one would expect from a 2-3 star chain hotel in the middle of a busy city. They all spoke excellent English. We did not use the breakfast or bar so cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “it's always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mppreus
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure to go back to this hotel. Central location, great views over the square and very nice people. Just like home... It's worth paying the supplement for the rooms with a square view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: D_Nicole85
Reviews.Content: I went to Barca with two friends for a short stay (3 days). We got a triple room (3 single beds). The room was bigger than expected, very clean, extra blankets, the bathroom was a good size. Everything was clean and the staff was very attentive and helpful! My friends felt the beds were a little too hard, but I thought they were fine. It was located right in the middle of the main attractions and super easy to get to and from the airport. I would definitely stay here again in my next trip to Barcelona! I would just be weary of the train stop at night - best to take a cab after 8PM!

Reviews.Title: “Mini Luxury Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_n10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect for my boyfriend and my needs, located right in the middle of the plaza (a busy high street area with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops etc) we was able to hop on and off the tour buses that were facing are hotel, plus there was many too choose from, and at great prices. There was also a airport shuttle bus that took you too and from the airport at such a great price 5 euros each! we were situated at the very top of the building in mini penthouse suite, it was a perfect little size and included a decking area with garden funiture. on request you could get this room. i happend too notice the other rooms were the same clean, tidy and very modern! breakfast and dinner area was beautifully decorated and all staff were pleasent and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to couples of all ages who want a nice hotel to go back too after a busy day of exploring what Barcelona has to offer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: loveitalydublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while on business in Barcelona. I had a room with a terrace that was perfectly quiet despite being slap bang in the centre of this wonderful city. The guy at reception was very helpful and welcoming. The room was spotless and the little terrace was a bonus, I was bowled over by the choice for breakfast each day. It was so wonderful to sit looking out at the Place de Catalunya while eating. There were complimentary snacks/drinks each evening but with all of Barcelona on your doorstep, it was too tempting to head out each evening. This hotlel was better than many 4 stars I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “great location-average hotel”
Reviews.Author: drwsurf
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in a triple. Good-location, free computer and snacks on P floor. Metro and Renfre train just outside. Beds, wifi and noise a downer. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “The best location for a short trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: NaderB0mbay
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a short trip to Barcelona, specially first time travellers. Its location is too good to be true : right on the central square, Plaza Catalunya. Getting to and from the airport is a breeze, as the very efficient Aerobus service drop off is right on the same square. Further, the square is located between the older part of the city (with its Barrio Gotic and the pedestrianised Ramblas) and the newer Eixample district (with its Passeig Gracia and Gaudis many stunning buildings). In addition, 2 of the major metro stops are right outside, so getting to the Sagrada Familia etc. is too easy. The hotel itself is modern, service is most polite and professional and the rooms facing the square are well worth the price. We did not opt for the breakfast so cant comment on it, but the hot chocolate at Zurich Cafe just outside is to die for. Also dont miss the tapas at Cal Pepe, near the Barceloneta area. It takes tapas to a whole new level, but be there early or you will have to wait a few years till you get your seat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, AC didn't work”
Reviews.Author: Tammy96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beginning and end of our trip to Spain. Our first two nights were excellent, the rooms were beautiful and clean, very modern and new furnishings, great shower, nice lobby with WiFi, great location near Mountjuic and the subway station and bus to the airport right next to the hotel.. The breakfast was a bit expensive for us and nothing special and was not included (10 E) so we passed the second morning. A week later we stayed for one more night in a similar room, but the air conditioning wasn't working. After waiting for 3 hours for the room to cool down we left to tour Barcelona and were told a technician would check it out. We arrived back late and it still was not fixed and was very hot in the room. Too bad we weren't offered another room earlier on as I asked (we were told they were fully booked by the time we returned) and no compensation was offered. Had a hot and humid night. Make sure the AC works before you unpack!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: EssexLollyB
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel we were met by a very friendly desk clerk who booked the 10 of us in without any hustle and told us straightaway about the free champagne and canapes on the first floor and told us to go and help ourselves once we had settled in. We were all lucky enough to have rooms facing the back of the hotel so didn't get any street noises. Those of us in triple rooms definitely fared better than the doubles. We had much more space and a nicer outlook over a swimming pool. Unfortunately though due to the 3rd bed being so close to the windows we couldn't open them properly. The rooms were all very clean though with clean towels daily. The air con took a while to sort out but we got there in the end after reporting the problem to the front desk. It was sorted out immediately. Cannot fault the breakfast in any way. Lovely selection and the fresh fruit was delicious, along with the coffee which was nice and hot. Couldn't get a better position for sightseeing. The tour buses stop right outside and very close to Las Ramblas and Place de Gracia. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location but select your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: tuscanwino69
Reviews.Content: We booked a "double" NOT facing the Plaza, to avoid nighttime noise. We were put into an extremely tiny, no doubt single, room with towels for two. No window, just an A/C that leaked condensation onto our luggage during the night. To compensate, we were given a free upgrade to a room facing the Plaza...which we should have booked in the first place because of its greater size and comfort. Good points: nice bar/restaurant right next door, taxi stand in front, main metro station right there, tour busses across the street, 5 minutes to La Rambla, room clean but not roomy, good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “close to la Rambla”
Reviews.Author: cornishmudslinger
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was ok. We had a few problems when we booked in, as members we should have had cava and chocolate on arrival but we did not get them. We had to wait as our room was not ready, after waiting nearly an hour I went to reception to find out whether or not it was ready and they were suprised to see me as it had been ready ages. The Manager was very apologetic and gave us our keys. The room was supposed to be a triple room but was a double with a sofa bed in what should have been a sitting area! There wasn't any dressing gowns in the room so we asked for them and were told they would send them up in jthe afternoon, it was already 4pm!!. We went out for a stroll and look around and the hotel is at the top of La Rambla which is an ideal location to get to everything. We finally got our dressing gowns when we got back to the hotel at around 9pm and a bottle of cava. I would recommend this hotel as it is central to most things and it was comfortable despite sleeping on a sofa bed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: King_tut1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Barcelona airport at 8:00 am from Toronto Canada and took the blue aerobus (A1) from the airport to Plaça Cataluña where “H10 Catalunya Plaza” is located. The hotel is central to everything and is in ideal location. We booked a triple room for 90 Euros per night, which is an excellent deal. The room is well furnished, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was well laid out. We left our luggage at the hotel and went for a walk thru La Rambla, this mile-long avenue is divided into five distinct sections. It's a stage set of human statues, jugglers, kiosks, birds, cafes, and beautiful flower stalls. We stopped at the Plaça Reial, which is one of the city's old squares, with neoclassical pillars and archways, 19th-century lampposts and aging palm trees. Then we went for a walk at Barri Gòtic, said to be the largest inhabited medieval quarter in Europe. We visited the Cathedral; this place of worship has seen many changes over the centuries, though it was thankfully one of the few to be spared the destruction of the Spanish Civil War. There was a mass service underway when we visited which was a very nice experience. We went back to the hotel for a break, took a nap for couple of hours and then made our way out for dinner at “Loja de Tapas” located at Pla Del Palau 7 which was an excellent choice for Tapas and I recommend it. The following morning I went out for an early morning jog which is a tradition I have whenever I arrive in a new city, then went back to the hotel to have breakfast with my wife and daughter at the hotel. Breakfast was excellent at the hotel and was reasonably priced. This day was intended to be a shopping day for most of the morning, so we started our strolled northwards along Passeig de Gràcia. This avenue is both urban and cosmopolitan. Lined with elegant buildings, trendy shops, and wonderful eating spots, it starts from Plaza Cataluña through the heart of Eixample, ending at the district of Gràcia. Shopping was good for the whole family and we were all content with our purchases. We had sandwiches for lunch and then continued northward towards Casa Milà; this is one of Gaudí’s masterpieces and it is really a block of apartments, the most original in the entire city, and a high point of our visit. We went on a tour of the building and were so impressed by the brilliance of Gaudi. We then took a Taxi to La Sagrada Família; We were at awe when we came out of the taxi and looked up towards this unearthly structure. This is Antoni Gaudí most revered masterpiece. The four original spires, which were created by the Master himself, are generally acknowledged to be far superior to the additional quartet. This is one of the most unique building I have ever seen and you must visit it if you go to Barcelona. Current construction progresses very slowly and you can see the artist and workers in action inside the cathedral. The most optimistic forecasters don’t believe the whole project will reach completion for at least another 40 years. The next day we spent the morning at the Museu Picasso (€9 per person) and what a wonderful place to visit. I had no idea how diverse Picasso’s style was until I visited the museum. There are more than 3,800 work of art arttribute to the master at this museum. Lunch was at a nearby small Italian restaurant “CAPUTXES”, 4 Davant De Sta. M. del Mar. They serve the best Italian food I have had in a long time and the staff was so nice and welcoming. Try to go there if you get a chance and you will not be disappointed. Our final stop was at Parc Güell, which is another of Gaudi’s masterpieces, is unlike any other park in the world. It is more like a fairy-tale place high up on top of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: ASM618
Reviews.Content: This place was a little more expensive (100 euros/night) than we normally spend, but it was worth the money. The room was very nice and had high speed wireless internet. The location is nice, right on the plaza and next to the subway stop and the Ramblas. Everyone was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: kate055
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights here the hotel is in a great location, there is tea and coffee in rooms, the breakfast was good with plenty of choice, the first double room we were given was tiny no way should it have been classed as a double, we did complain and were moved to larger room over looking the square. The hotel is clean but there is an awful sewer smell at the lift shaft, there is wine and tea and coffe in the afternoon and snacks which is a nice touch, I would reccomend this hotel but make sure and ask for larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking service, noisy, worst hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Brookers09
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Barcelona for his birthday 2 weeks ago. It was supposed to be a romantic getaway and thought I had chosen wisely...I was proved wrong!Room 317 was small to say the least and certainly not worth the 180euros a night it cost to stay there. If the cackling chambermaids didn't wake you in the morning then you can be sure to be regularly woken (day and night) by the bottle bins being emptied from the bar/restaurant; the room was also very cold. Breakfast the following morning was as luke warm as the service! Later on, a trip to the bar was the final straw. A beer for my boyfriend and a vodka and coke for myself proved too difficult a task for the incompetent bar person who proceeded to serve the bottle of beer with a filthy, dirty glass and served me just a coke because she didn't know what Vodka was!!She deserted the bar when she couldn't find the vodka and so my drink order was finished off by someone completely different who went on to dribble vodka in the miniscule amount of space left in the glass. I was shocked to say the least and I can honestly say it is the worst service I have ever received in a hotel! In genereal the hotel lift area smelt of drains, our room key had to be changed twice because it didn't work, at one point we were given the key to room 307!!!Just as well we were so honest! All in all we won't ever be using a H10 hotel ever again and they should seriously consider the value of what they offer and what they charge!!(improving the staff's english skills wouldn't hurt either!!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place and Will Return”
Reviews.Author: msmomSeattle
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a decent place after fleeing the Hotel Ginebra (see my review on that place by searching). We walked around and found this place across the street from the hotel we wanted to get out of and we asked to see a double room. The double was a reasonable size (I've seen smaller rooms and bathrooms having stayed in Manhattan), there were many electrical outlets for recharging gadgets and a laptop, and the room and hotel was modern, clean, and pleasant. And when we stayed there the week of November 19th 2008 it was 60E a night. Sold! You cannot beat that price, the location, and the quality of accomodation. We were so pleased that I hope that when we return it is still there. BTW, we had stayed at the five star Rey Juan Carlos I for four nights before staying here and this place still impressed me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Titcher
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12.30pm and the reception looked nice small but nice. We went up to the room to discover it was more like a wardrobe than a bedroom. The room was so small and had the smallest double bed I have ever seen. The bathroom was tiny, it was really just an excuse for a bathroom. The window looked out onto a brick wall. I just could not stay in the room, you could only access the bed from one side. We went back down to reception to complain and see if there were any bigger rooms. She sent us up to look at a twin room, the only differences were two single beds in the room and the window gave more light. We just could not stay here for the weekend. I had looked up the hotel Olivia when searching and it was also in Placa Catalunya, its a four star hotel and the rooms were massive and very modern. We had to pay one nights accommodation as a cancellation fee to the H10 but it was worth it to get out of there. short walk across the placa and we were in hotel Olivia in a fab room and full length window looking onto the Placa. Would highly recommend this hotel and the staff, worth payin that little bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tomblieboo
Reviews.Content: stopped in h10 catalunya plaza in jan08, found the hotel to be clean and breakfast good. the hotel is right in the centre at catalunya plaza ideal for the drop off from the airport bus, subway and the open top site seeing bus points. ideal location and didnt find it noisy, would definitly stay there again and visit barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RJHNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night post cruise. Had a family room (3 0f us)- size was fine and third bed was in a little walk through area at the end of the room which gave a degree of privacy. Staff helpful. Free internet access, coffee, snacks and wine in lounge. The location of the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: superged
Reviews.Content: location is perfect : central, transport (from airport or to access metro) rooms are clean but very small (triple room has inappropriate size) personnel attention is poor (one night, waited 20 minutes outside ringing before someone showed up [I will not detail what I think he was doing]) changed to stay in another hotel closeby for approx. the same price (look around on booking siets) that was far far better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clanman
Reviews.Content: A family friend recommended the H10 Catalunya Plaza. I booked through the hotel website and requested a room over looking the Plaza. By taking the A1 bus from Barcelona Airport, it final stop is the Catalunya Plaza. The bus stop is on the opposite side of the Plaza to the hotel. We arrived at 1200hrs but the hotel receptionist where very helpful and gave us access to the room ahead of the normal check in time. I had registered with H10 Club, which is free but it does provide additional services, robes, fruit and chocolates in your room. The room was situated on the third floor over looking the Plaza. Large French doors allowed access to a smal balacony. It was noticable with the doors open, the noise from the busy Plaza, but the sound proofing was very good, when they were shut. The room was on a split level, with the entrance, wardrobes and bathroom breng on one level and two steps down, to the bed, large desk and drawers. The room had a kettle with tea & coffee provided and a small fridge. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked, but it was not noticeable noisey when working. The bathroom was a good size, with a powerful shower and numerous towels. The decor of the room was very good and it was very clean. The hotel provides, free coffee, water and cakes throughout the day, in a smal business area. It also has two internet PC's with free access. The breakfast is served in a large room over looking the Plaza. There is a wide range of cold and hot food and the quality is very good. Due to the location of the hotel in the centre of Barcelona, it is idea to travel to locations, via foot, metro or bus. We found it easier to walk around the city, as it allows you to take in the wealth of history which has made Barcelona a modern and historical city. We plan on going again and will be staying at the H10 Catalunya Plaza, excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobics beware”
Reviews.Author: Gillsjourneys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in May. This was my 4th trip in 4 years and this is unfortunately the worst hotel in terms of standard of accommodation. The location is brilliant - right on the Plaza Catalunya and seconds away from Las Ramblas, the more refined Passeig de Gracia with its modernista buildings and minutes from the Gothic quarter (diagonally across the square from hotel). But the entrance to the hotel is small and unwelcoming. The complimentary cava at the reception desk was a nice touch. But this did not compensate for the tiny room we were allocated. All I can say is, if you are allocated a room on 1st floor beware. The room (although spotless) was very small. There was no natural light and nowhere to sit and relax other than on the bed. The only way to see what the weather was like, in the absence of a window to the outside, was to leave the room and make your way either to the breakfast room (breakfast was wonderful with lots of choice for even the most picky of eaters) or downstairs to the lobby to be able to look outside. Other rooms must be superior in quality (apparent from other reviews on this site) so we must have been just unlucky that we ended up in a shoebox . It did not spoil our stay - Barcelona is a fabulous city and I will be returning soon but not to the Catalunya Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alnewell
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we stayed at the Catalunya Plaza and I would still highly recommend it. We were there 3 nights for a long weekend, and it suits us perfectly as easy to get to from the airport (using the airport bus), as the stop is opposite near Corte Ingles. Breakfast is good - plentiful and fresh - and our room was fine. The rooms are on the small side, but as you're not in them during the day they're fine. This time we had a room overlooking the back courtyard which was really quiet and peaceful - in fact I think we would choose that over one looking out the front again. Everywhere is walkable, and some really good hidden bars etc just of Ramblas waiting to be discovered - away from all the touristy things! Highly recommended hotel - if you're booking through the H10 website become a member of their club and you get freebies (we had chocolates, fresh fruit etc left in our room).

Reviews.Title: “Just hope you have no problems!”
Reviews.Author: pricewise
Reviews.Content: I called into the hotel and asked for a price for two nights for a double room. The receptionist gave a rate and wrote this down on the back of a business card. based on other hotels I took this to be the total price! On checking out I was presented with a bill DOUBLE the amount. Despite my protests nothing was done to correct this. I have since written to H10 in Barcelona and London SEVEN times and have not had the decency of a reply. So if you stay at this overrated and overpriced hotel just hope that you are problem free as they don't care enough about their guests to sort anything out. Blatent arrogance. BEWARE you have been warned!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonamom
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 5 nights at H10 Catalunya Plaza. We stayed in triple room, room 206. I had asked for room 313 facing the square, but we got there early at 8:00 am and were able to check right in, in room 206. It had a double bed, and a small sitting area with a couch that converted to a single bed. Which was fine. It faced a back courtyard. It was very quiet. So quiet, it felt like we were the only ones in the hotel, and of course that wasn't the case. The breakfast buffet was huge, same things every day. If I go back I wouldn't book the breakfast. Since you eat dinner so late in Barcelona, we weren't really hungry for breakfast. And it was so-so. The hotel has free coffee, tea, wine, pastries, and mini sandwiches in the lounge. That was a big draw for me booking the hotel, but again we really didn't use it. They had free internet, two computers in the lounge. We used them twice. I never saw anyone else using them. And we had one english channel, CNN. Friends who stayed in a more expensive hotel had no english channels. The room was immaculately cleaned everday, they provided us with 2 bathrobes. The location was great. We took the Aerobus up and back from the airport. It lets you off across the hotel, and you pick it up across the square. The hotel is in the center of everything. The beginning of La Ramblas is one block away, and the gothic area 5 minutes away. We were one block off of Passeig De Gracia the main Blvd. I had originally wanted to book a hotel in the gothic area, but now am glad I didn't. Its very dark, and small narrow streets at night. I felt very safe at the H10 Catalunya Plaza as its on a huge lit up square, and there always seemed to be people around. I would definitley recommend this hotel. Great value for the $. Be sure to go to Caelum, up Carrer Palla, a little pastry shop in the gothic area and sit in the cafe. Wonderful. And eat at Taller De Tapas also in the gothic area on Plaza Sant Josep Oriol. We took the hop on hop off bus and got a two day pass. You get the bus in front of the hotel. There are two routes, the second leaves from across the square. Lots to do. We loved Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, great staff and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: kriton
Reviews.Content: Prompted by poor reviews, felt I had to state my husband and small daughter and I spent three very happy days in Barcelona at this hotel, the room was super, we actually asked to move to an inside room as the Plaza Espanya is a little noisy if window open, but thats the price of the terrific view which it also boasts! The hotel is easily on par with Hilton or similar, if a little dated externally - internally the rooms bright and smart, and an amazingly varied breakfast, freshly baked pastries in front of you, great hot and cold buffet. Housekeeping excellent, beds turned down every evening, well stocked etc. Super staff and a great doorman. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The right location”
Reviews.Author: backhouseboy
Reviews.Content: We booked direct with the hotel through H10 hotels own website - they guarantee to beat any other rate and did so by quite a margin on some sites. Ideal central location right at the top of La Rambla. Used the 'Barcelona Bus' from Girona airport (return cost 21` euros) but this dropped us off at Arc de Triumph bus station two metro stops away. I have since discoved that there is another airport bus which is cheaper and drops you of in the Catalunya Plaza itself. The Hotel is quite small with only the reception desk on ground floor. The Hotel itself is fine - H10 hotels are usually excellent - but try to avoid a 4th Floor room - the lift gives up at the third floor! and our room was small and virtually windowless. To be fair we were moved into a better one the following day. Snacks & drinks - wine ,coffee etc.available free during the day. All in all ,a value for money stay - the location being excellent for popping in and out ,and, we would definitely stay again. One small point is that the two computers for the use of guest do not have printers and I encountered a problem when trying to obtain an 'online' boarding pass for our return flight. In the end I was allowed use the computer at the reception desk and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “H10 great location”
Reviews.Author: tMCL
Reviews.Content: H10 is a great location at Catalunya Plaza opposite the Corte Ingles department store. Although pricey the location somewhat makes up for it and the airport bus drops you off across the Plaza. There were a few teething problems with the card for the room door which wouldn't work. This took a day and five different cards to resolve. The room was tiny although very nice. The bedlinen and some towles weren't changed during my stay which was unacceptable given the cost of the room. There is free internet access in a lounge area which is really useful. Overall a great location but not worth the money I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: citysi
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience. The first point to mention was the great location, this hotel is on a great site overlooking the Catalunya Plaza (square). I would definately reccomend staying in this area, it is central to some great shops and eateries, as well as being a two minute walk from Las Ramblas. The hotel itself is a beautiful classic building, with wrought-iron, shuttered balconies overlooking the square. The communal areas are very modern, and clean (almost boutique style). The rooms are small but perfectly formed. Nice clean bathroom, good storage, plasma wall mounted tv. I was lucky to stay in a room with an excellent view of the Plaza ; I requested this view, and would reccomend anyone considering staying here to do the same. The reception staff were lovely, and you actually are greeted with a glass of Cava when you check in! The only downside was the breakfast, the buffet style hot food was crispy and dry . The breakfast staff were not very pleasant, and over the three days I stayed there I had to ask them for coffee each time as they did not come near any tables. To be honest this was only a slight snag , and did not impact on my stay. Overall I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a mid-price hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Money we will return!”
Reviews.Author: EAGLES06
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona just for one night on 24/10/07,so although it was a brief stay in the wonderful city it was very enjoyable. Having read the reviews on this Hotel we took some tips and travelled via the bus from right outside the airport which was really easy and excellent value! 10 euros for the 3 of us. We stayed in a triple room 313 for 190 euros including breaky and i could not fault anything,the hotel was clean and perfectly located on the top end of the Rambles,we walked all the way to the beach and got a bus back due to my i mean my sons aching legs! The hotel staff could not have been more helpful so go on book it its really great. Check out is 12 which is good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: delnshell
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Plaza Catalunya on the 12th Oct through to the 15th Oct. On arrival late on the friday night (24.00hrs) we were told there wasn't a room available as they were fully booked! Even though we had paid upfront through Hotelsdirect we were instructed to walk 5 mins around the corner to the Hotel Universtat where there would be a 4 star room waiting for us. After a false start with bad directions and carrying our luggage through the streets 20mins later on arrival at the Universtat we were told this would be only for one night and we would have to move back the next day!!. We were not very pleased and did not have a good nights sleep in that 4star hotel (very noisy). On return to the Plaza next day we can only say that we were very pleased with assistance and help we received. We were given a complentary bottle of champers and a very pleasant room over looking the Plaza with views down Las Rambla's. We would stay there again despite the hiccups with one member of night staff on arrival. The female manager more than made up for this and i would reccommend this Hotel to anyone wanting to explore the Las Ramblas area of Barcelona. The bus from the airport drops you within two minutes walk of the hotel, all of the trains and metros are on your doorstep and even the bus tours start at the Plaza Sq!! A great place to go and a great Hotel to stay in. Del and Shell

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But.......”
Reviews.Author: Baroff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 2007 for long weekend break. Hotel scores highly for location - Catalunya Sq at top of La Rambla, food - excellent hot or cold breakfast with plenty of choice, staff - kind and considerate. However if you are unlucky enough to be allocated one of the smaller rooms then your stay will be a nightmare. These rooms are really only singles but the hotel try and pass them off as doubles. Insist on one of the rooms facing the square and you will be OK. Furnishings and decor all good standard and bathrooms well appointed and decent size even with the smaller rooms. Would definitely go back again but only on the understanding that I had one of the rooms facing the square on either 1st, 2nd, or 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Room - Don't go with flyglobespan!”
Reviews.Author: tartanryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for a short mid-week break and first visit to Barca. The hotel is on the Plaça Catalunya so the location is ideal. You get the A1 airport bus to the square and you are right at the hotel. Flights were from Glasgow with flyglobespan and 5 hours late. This seemed to be the case on a daily basis. On the return leg, a flight to Edinburgh with the same airline due to depart 13.35 was scheduled to leave at 20:00. Avoid them! Check-in was fine with a little gift of some biscuits on arrival in the room. The room (210) was the smallest I have ever stayed in. Looking at the floor plan on the emergency exit I think I was unlucky as it looked the smallest on floor 2. Try to avoid this room if you can. Really not room to swing a cat! It was very clean and well fitted out. Not worth140 euros per night B&B. Breakfast was good with a wide selection of cereals, cakes and pastries, cheeses and meats, little sandwiches, juices etc. The cooked selection was average but you might be a little unhappy if you like your british fry up. Disappointing bangers which were more like hot dog sausages and the bacon was really more like the waffer ham you get at the supermarket. There is free wi-fi in all the rooms and if you don't take your laptop there are also two PCs with internet access which can be used for FREE. Only one was working during my stay so you often had to wait or come back. In the afternoon the hotel served FREE sandwiches and cakes/pastries in the lounge area. Also served was coffee/tea and if you wanted it Cava. A really nice touch. The hotel staff were helpful and curteous. Check-out was a bit drawn out as the sole receptionist was keener on answering the telephone than dealing with the queue of departing guests and took about 20 minutes. If you are paying with a Credit Card beware of how they charge you. I was charged in £ sterling with a 2% surcharge for conversion rather than in euros when my card issuer would not have charged this. They are supposed to ask you if you want to pay in euros and sterling so if you have a card which doesn't charge a foreign currency fee (eg Nationwide) make sure you pay in euros. All in all a good hotel which on a good day will be excellent. The location alone is reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzannedeijnen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely girls only weekend in Barcelona staying at the catalunya plaza which we booked through trip advisor (glad we read your reviews before we went they were spot on!). We found the hotel to be very clean and easy to get to from the airport you just hop on the A1 aerobus outside the terminal and the bus takes you right to the stop opposite the hotel just a short stroll across the square. The staff were extremely nice and helpful, we had breakfast included in are stay and there was so much variety to choose from we were spoiled for choice there was a selection of fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurts, bacon, sausage, eggs, beans, toast and fresh rolls also a selection of meats and juices not to mention tea and coffee. Also in the afternoon complimentary drinks of bottled water, wine and cava were on offer along with sanwiches and little cakes wow! We would definately stay at the catalunya plaza again if we visit Barcelona are only gripe is that we didn't stay long enough to visit all the sites! Suzanne Cheshire, Kim Solihull and Sam Birmingham

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve-and-Lesley2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights before moving to Hotel Neptuno in Tossa de Mar for 7 nights (see separate review). The Hotel lived up to previous reviews. It is in a great location on Plaza Catalunya - at the top of the Ramblas and really on the divide between the Barri Gotic (the old part) and the Eixample (expansion) for the Modernista architecture. Could probably walk to either the port or to the Sagrada Familia in 20 minutes if you wish - but taxis are very reasonable if you don't wish. Personally we felt Ramblas was rather seedy and there were much nicer areas. Room was good with small balcony overlooking Plaza. Air con was effective, and bathroom OK. Would have liked a double bed, but two singles were pushed together. Breakfast was excellent - wide selection of hot and cold, savoury and sweet (and even Cava!) available from 8 to 11.30 in August. The hotel also provide free afternoon cakes and drinks including wine and Cava, but to my chagrin I failed to fully capitalise on this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the H10 Catalunya Plaza- Best Location”
Reviews.Content: My sister, nephew and I just returned from a week in Barcelona. The location and convenience of the hotel are excellent. For us the hotel's key attribute is being midway between all of the star attractions without being in Las Ramblas. The staff were very helpful and we look forward to returning. We booked a Triple which we highlly recommend. The 3 single beds were tight (by American Standards) but comfortable. We don't spend lots of time in hotels. In the future I will book the triple room for double occupancy for a bit more space. We were in room 313 which appears to be one of the largest (also 312 ). There are only six triples in the hotel so book early. DO Not book 308 or 309. Too Tiny for a single person. Take the A-1 bus to the hotel from the airport. The cost is 3.75 euro/person vs. 30-35 euro for a taxi. The airport bus stop is located across the street from the Taxi que. The hotel is the last stop and takes only 25-30 minutes from the airport. You walk across the plaza (1 minute) to the hotel. Should you take the bus for your departure, note the terminal (A, B or C) for your flight arrival. Awesome trip. Great hotel/location.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: catisha2000
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this hotel, I decided to book it for myself and my boyfriend for a midweek break. I'm delighted to say that the reviews on this website are spot on, it's a great hotel in a fantastic location. Having phoned ahead to ask for a front facing room, this is exactly what we received and the views over the plaza are fantastic. On arrival we were greeted very warmly by the front desk staff and offered champagne to welcome us. The rooms are not huge but adequate in size and exceptionally clean. I was surprised that we were supplied with only 1 (quite rough) bath robe but there were plenty of towels and bathroom accessories. Don't expect an awful lot from the hot breakfast but what they supply for a cold breakfast is fantastic. Also, the free pastries, tea/coffe etc in the principal room is a great touch- as is the free internet access. The only complaint I have is that there is a serious lack of milk for tea/coffee in the hotel and we always had to ask for it. Other than that though, I would happily return for another visit and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Day Break "Very Nice"”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterUKAndy
Reviews.Content: We had a four day break in Barcelona Spain, in June 2007, arrived Monday returned home on the Friday. Hotel was very nicely situated in the city centre on Catalunya Plaza, very easy to get to from the Airport. The bus stops on one side of the plaza and the hotel is on the other side. The Hotel was comfortable without being ‘over the top’, there was one or two minor problems, we arrived at 2pm and the room wasn’t ready (Check in time is 1pm) staff were apologetic and had the room ready in one hour, and the phone didn’t work.
