The room was a twin which about the right size (not large but certainly not small) for this price of hotel, it was very clean and staff were helpful and friendly. The room itself overlooked the plaza. A free bottle of Cava and welcoming letter was left in the room on the first day. Breakfast was between 7-11am with a good selection of food with meats, cornflakes, pastries, toast, juice etc (and you could east as much as you liked) There was free internet access in small lounge with coffee and pastries in late afternoon. There was a cross section of customers, some couples on holiday ( I didn’t see any children) other were there on business; they were from all around the world. I did not hear of anyone complaining. Basically very comfortable and clean, but the location sells it, La Rambla and all the other Barcelona attractions are within easy walking distance as are some very nice bars and restaurants. I would stay there again Andy, Manchester UK

Reviews.Title: “When can we go back!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday Helper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, central for Las Ramblas, 15 minutes walk from the Port and across the road from the stops for Bus Turistic. Our room was clean and the breakfast was amazing Plenty choice including a glass of cava if you would like one! The hotel had the total package and if you are in floor 'P' you can help yourself every late afternoon to coffee, tea, baguettes, and of course a glass of cava free of charge. Sadly while I was there I fell and ended up in hospital so on return to the hotel I could not carry on with the tourist trips. So to the people who were at the hotel last weekend and could not get any cava my apolgies it was me who drank it all!!! We would certainly go back to this hotel. The staff are friendly and attentive and the City is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “What a little treasure..................”
Reviews.Author: CITYBREAKERSCAMBS
Reviews.Content: Yet again Trip Advisor comes up trumps. This Hotel is a real find not only for it's location but for the sheer value you get for your money. We stayed in a family room on the first floor with added luxury of our own patio! Room adequate and kept spotlessly clean by our maids. Unusually for a 3 * towels were larger and fluffy and plentiful , none of that trying to dry off on a piece of cardboard. The real find here though is breakfast which is large, varied and of a very high quality. Hotel is very well placed with all tourist buses, taxis, Metro and local buses all easily accesible in the very busy square outside. If you sense a rumble in the night it is not an earthquake merely the Metro running some metres under the hotel. Barcelona is a gem of a city with lots to see and do. Make use of the discount vouchers you get with the Tourist bus, the latter is by far the best way to see the many delights on offer. Although we had been warned of pickpockets etc we had no trouble but did take extra care.

Reviews.Title: “excelent location, facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: Neadog
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. It's right in the centre and in a pleasant area. It is close to all public transport: buses, trains, metros, tourist buses, and airport bus. The reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly and answered any questions we had. They also spoke excellent English. We had a double room with a sofa bed. A cot with proper baby bed linen was provided for our baby, who was free. The room was a comfortable size and had a good sized balcony/terrace which was a godsend with the baby. At least 4of the 6 rooms on the first floor (Floor P) had access to a similar terrace. Breakfast was included and had a vast choice: yoghurts, pastires, cakes, cereals, cold meats, salads, savoury baguettes, fruit, cooked meats and scrambled eggs. The lounge on floor P had internet access and refreshments avaialable for guests all day long; bottled water, tea, coffee sandwiches, pastries and some cava in the evening. I thought it was excellent value for the location and facilities

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in main square”
Reviews.Author: drbob193
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in mid April in a room (213) overlooking the square. The rooms are fairly typical city centre hotel rooms. The ones overlooking the square have doors and a small balcony. Other rooms seemed to be smaller and overlook enclosed light wells. The only problem was that the air conditioning was not working when we arrived and the weather was quite warm. We were ok because we could ventilate our room with the French doors, but people staying in the rooms at the back said their rooms were much too warm and ventilation was inadequate. The aircon was fixed for our third night. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We particularly liked the breakfast with a large selection of cold meats, cheeses, breads, fruits and a small hot buffet. There was even Cava available if you wanted it. We also liked the buffet provided in the afternoons / evenings. The computers provided for internet access were very slow, but free. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again if we come back to Barcelona. One general point - Barcelona does not seem to be anything like as safe as it used to be - we had our camera stolen at a sidewalk cafe and when we went to the police station to get a report for our insurers we were shocked at how many other tourists were there reporting similar thefts. Take very great care of all your personal belongings and valuables in this city!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AmyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a short break in Barcelona where I stayed at the Catalunya Plaza with my Mum. The hotel itself is in the heart of Barcelona, in the Plaza at the top of The Ramblas, which is very easy to get to from the airport, just hop on the Aerobus A1 and it taks you directly there for 3.95 Euros. The great location is matched by the friendly staff and lovely rooms in the hotel. Although the rooms are quite small they offer everything you need. Our room had a lovely balcony overlooking the Plaza. In fact my Mum had stayed there in December with friends and had enjoyed her stay so much that she decided to return as soon as she got back. Her positive attitude was partly due to the wonderful breakfast offered, which includes everything you might like such as, hot breakfast, fruit, youghurt, cereals and pastries, but the hotel also offers complimentary wine, cava, tea, coffee and snacks of pastries and sandwiches every afternoon and free internet access! My only reservation would be the noise from staying right on the Plaza, we were fine as in the evenings we could close the double-glazed patio windows, but in the Summer it would be far too noisy to have them open. Overall ,we had a fabulous time in Barcelona, its a great city, and our stay in the Catalunya Plaza couldn't have been better due to the friendly staff, great food and brilliant location. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at H10 Catalunya Plaza”
Reviews.Author: B40487
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over a weekend at the end of January. The hotel is centrally located in Barcelona and very convenient for walking to the sights of the city or taking the tourist buses from the Catalunya Plaza for those places further afield. Our room had a balcony looking over the square (Catalunya Plaza) which is buzzing throughout the day and evening, but at night the double glazing works perfectly and once closed you cannot hear a thing. The room rates are very good value, the rooms themselves are very clean and comfortable. Breakfast sets you up for the day and was taken from a large buffet selection, in a comfortable dining room The hotel staff were very helpful and they provide a discounted rate for parking in the secure car park beneath Catalunya Plaza. We would stay again anytime we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Montypaws
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Catalunya Plaza at the beginning of Feb 07 to celebrate a friend's birthday. As previously stated, the hotel is situated on the Plaza Catalunya (obviously) and opposite El Cortes Ingles, so has excellent transport links and is a great place to walk and see the sights from. The rooms, albeit small, were very clean and functional - just what you need for a city break as you don't spend hours in your room, thankfully the walls weren't paper thin and we did not encounter any noise on an evening (except perhaps our own). Although we had to pay for our breakfast, we thought it was well worth doing as there was a good choice (English breakfast items, cold meats, fruit, pastries, cereal etc) and a good price (we got it for half price - 7.5 Euros per person per day). Perhaps the real treat of this hotel was the free cava and wine that was on offer between 1230 and 2100hrs each day along with tea, coffee and mineral water and snacks. Additionally, free internet access was available in the same area - an excellent place to start an evening! I would suggest that if you're interested in tapas, do not visit the marina area - you pay for the location! Do try Le Qinze Nits and it's sister restaurant Le Fonda (?) both located in the Barri Gotic however be aware that you will need to queue on a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocodung
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights near X'mas time. Hotel is in good location: just opposite Aerobus and tourist bus station, metro and train station is also very nearby , walking distance to Las Rambles and Avda. Portal de I'Angel. We stayed on second floor facing backyard with no noise problem. Room is basic and clean. Receptionists are friendly and speak good English. There is free internet access at basement level. We paid 80 Euro (room itself) per night considered a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn'f fault, definatly go back !!”
Reviews.Author: DeanoR
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I discovered that you could get a bus directly from the airport to Place de Catalunya where the hotel is located and indeed this is correct and couldn't be easier or cheaper, for only 3.75 Euro PP we got on the "Aerobus" which delivered us to the square in about 20mins. Then all we had to do was walk across the square to find our hotel, we were greeted very pollitely and although we didn't get a glass of champagne on arrival we did habe a BOTTLE of it wating in our room - I had not informed the hotel that it was wife's birthday but they given this bottle to celebrate which was a very nice touch. Anyway Location is fantastic, we had a tripple rooom as our young son was with us and this room was fine - but a bit hot towards the end of the day (Air-con not working ?) Breakfast was plentyful and the price was included in our room rate, we got there a bit late on the 2 mornings that we ate and there wasnt much of the "english" style breakfast left but still enough of other styles of food left to fill my stomach. We didn't find out if they still did the free drinks in the hotel as we got back there too late to sample, but they were never mentioned to us. All in all a really fantastic little break and I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I would definatly stay here again if we were to re-visit. I contacted the Hotel directly to book and the whole thing could not have been easier, and as for getting around the city this really is a fantasically central location with bus stops and the metro within yards, and many of the attractions were in walking distance anyway. So go and explore and you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: eurostar75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August 2006 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was perfectly located for the aerobus drop off - just a short stroll across the Plaza and you were at the door. The reception staff were extremely polite and helpful at all times and there was a constant supply of cava and nibbles on the reception desk. Our room was on the third floor overlooking the plaza so had a great view and we didnt experience any problems with traffic noise etc. The room itself was small, clean and functional - everything you need and great for the price. I tend to judge a hotel by its breakfast (the great breakfast reviews were what sold me on this hotel in the first place) and I wasnt disappointed. The staff were efficient and polite here too. The snacks in the first floor lobby were also excellent - a really nice touch and certainly kept us going until tapas time! Location wise - great for exploring just about every area of the city as its on the brink of las ramblas (very touristy but has to be done once), ciutat vella (find somewhere unexplored every time you enter) and the funky el born (loads of restaurants we simply didnt have time to try). If you arent foot shy then you'll get more of a feel for the place by exploring on foot - we walked miles - although the metro is handy too. Finally, some recommendations for dining out at night - "Ginger" wine and tapas bar was truly excellent for authentic and novel tapas. Located between Carrer Palma de Sant Just and Carrer Lledo - its a bit hidden away but definitely worth the search. Also worth checking out is "origen 99.9%" on Passeig del Born. They serve authentic Catalan dishes which are taster sized so you can order a few. Worth going in just to read the menu - more like a magazine with info about the origin of the dishes etc. They have a shop attached too where they have more Catalan goodies on sale. Barcelona def has lots to offer and theres always the beach if you run out of steam. As for the hotel, we would definitely recommend it as it had all the benefits of a well established chain hotel but with a friendly and personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “You can find much better!”
Reviews.Author: my2emeralds
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Barcelona earlier this month. We stayed at Hotel America for 3 nights, then THOUGHT we wanted to be closer to Las Ramblas, so moved to H10 Catalunya. Not a great idea! We were definitely disappointed. The rooms are the smallest I have ever seen anywhere, and the bathrooms are about the size of a closet. The walls were so thin at this hotel, it was absolutely ridiculous! I could hear everything that was going on next to me and above me. Everytime the people above me took a shower or flushed the toilet, I expected a tidal wave to come into my room b/c the sound was so loud! The location is great. It's right in the middle of everything, and there's a subway station just outside of the door. I wasn't very impressed with any of the restaurant choices -- we actually ended up eating at Hard Rock Cafe 3 nights in a row. It was sad! Overall, I think you can find much better than H10 Catalunya. I'd suggest Hotel America. It's about a mile up Las Ramblas, but was a much nicer place and I got it for a steal (100 euros on Expedia).

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Mighty-Red
Reviews.Content: The location of this relatively small hotel on the Placa Catalunya is prime, just roll out in the morning and you're straight onto the Bus Turistic, into the Ramblas or across shopping at El Corte Ingles. Check-in was smooth & quick and the room was a good size for Barcelona. Only niggle was that the air-con was pathetic. Breakfast was superb, and the restaurant not being open in the evening meant you were forced to go to one of the big choice of restaurants locally. (Our favourite was 7 Portes in Barcelonetta, after which the evening is well spent along the harbour area as the Ramblas can get overpowering.) The 1st floor lounge with complementary snacks & internet was a godsend to chill-out between a hard days sightseeing and the late Barcelona dinner. This hotel is thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Suited me well”
Reviews.Author: Fieldsy
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read were mixed but I enjoyed my stay. The room was on the top floor, one floor after the lift finished, and looked out onto a drab yard. Getting up the extra floor was only 3 short flights of 7 steps, and I was seldom in the hotel to see the view so all was fine. Really well placed, on Plaça Catalunya, for most things of interest you're likely to want in the city. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've seen - great display of fruits, cheeses and cold meats. Plus chafing dishes with bacon, fried eggs, scrambled eggs, two types of sausage, and beans. Also bread, preserves, cereals, youghurts etc. Can't think of a potential breakfast item that wasn't available. Clean, tidy, and well serviced. I'd certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: yves.werder
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend (26) and me (26) stayed for a long weekend at the H10. This Hotel really is in the heart of Barcelona !! Just standing on the balcony and watching the pulse of this nice city is amazing. Of course if you're looking for a calm room you're in the wrong location. The room was o.k. but not terrific and the bed as well. In this price class I have had better ones especially longer ones :-) but maybe the spanish guests are shorter?? The water pressure is not really that good as well. We visited two friends in different hotels and they both had a bit better value for their money. As well service in the breakfast room was very nasty and arrogant. Even for Europeans like us we believe they should treat guests nicer in breakfast room. The first day we were not offered tea nor coffee. But the reception desk was very nice and helpful and as were the service people in general. All in all iI believe the hotel to be bit overpriced. If you are willing to walk 500m into Plaza Catalunya you will find better values.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room, good location and some nice touches.”
Reviews.Author: NikG
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in September 2005 for 5 nights. We had asked for a room at the front of the hotel, but were put at the back, on the top floor. The lift only went as far as the floor below ours, and we had to get the stairs up to our room. The room itself was off an alcove that had doors to three other rooms, and we could hear people coming and going (and banging doors) at all hours. The room itself was fine, modern furniture and decent facilities, but the shower head wouldn't stay on its holder. There was no view from the window, and the room wasn't huge. The hotel itself is in a great location, right at the top of the Ramblas and with access to Barcelona's metro system on the doorstep (v handy). There are plenty of great places to eat within minutes. Les Quinze Nits is a fantastic restaurant with extremely reasonable prices; it's just off the Ramblas on Placa Reial, but get there early as they don't book tables and there's always a massive queue (open at 8pm on an evening). If you can't get in there, try La Fonda on calle Escudellers - it's run by the same people. Breakfast in the hotel was good - there was a large range of options to please everyone (sliced meats & cheese, pastries, full English, fruit & yoghurt, cereals etc). The free drinks and snacks on the first floor were a nice touch too, and the internet access was handy. The complimentary glass of Cava on arrival was nice too! Overall, this was fine as a base of operations for sight-seeing, but I am sure there are more romantic places to stay in this beautiful, if bustling, city. Having said that, we had just come from 5 nights at the Plaza Mayor in Madrid (recommended if you can get the attic suite), which spolied us somewhat!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with many ants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't available to check-in until late afternoon. Once in the tiny room we discovered it was full of ants. I would estimate there were over 20 to 30 ants on the floor at one time. Telling the front desk attendant about the ants, she seem unconcerned and was suprised this was an issue. Having no other rooms we checked-out and were not charged.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in Barcelona - fantastic hotel. asked for room with view over Plaza and this is what we got (Room 313) The location is perfect, just at the top of Ramblas and ideal for tour bus. What can i say about the hotel which hasn't already been said, clean , great breakfast, great staff and the tea & coffee after a hard days sightseeing was very welcome. Barcelona is a fantastic city. you need more than 2 nights. Went on tour bus on top deck & got sun burn as the weather was very warm (25deg) stopped off at New Stadium for a tour - very good value for money - only 10 euros for full tour. Gothic quarters brilliant and went round at night time - didn't feel intimidated at all - found a great Irish pub called Ryans bar. All in all a great city break and quite reasonable prices. Found nice Pizza restaurant on Ramblas which was very reasonable (on Left hand side not far from top of Ramblas) - go for this hotel and this city - you'll have a fantastic time

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, but tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: JKnyc
Reviews.Content: Like everyone said, the hotel is very centrally located. We were greated by friendly staff at the reception with an offer of free wine. The room: Looking back, we should have asked for a room with a view (after having just read the other reviews here). I think because we didn't have any particulars, they gave us the smallest room they had that faced an airshaft. It was somewhat bitter for us because we had a huge room in Madrid for a third cheaper in price per night, but we dealt with it. The space in room 308 is so tiny that only one person can walk around the double bed at any time without throwing the other person onto the bed! (I felt like we were in a ship cabin.) So if you're considering staying here, do not ask for rooms ending in 8 or 9 (which are the smallest rooms in the hotel, according to their detailed emergency exit floor plan). The breakfast: This was the second highlight of the hotel, after the location. It was a great spread filled with a variety of sliced fruits, hot dishes, cold cuts, cheeses, and pastries. I really didn't expect anything like this in ANY hotel, quite frankly! The dining room was also quite nice, with views out onto the plaza. To sum up, getting that tiny room was a toss-up upon check-in. We could have later complained and asked for a larger room if any were available, but chose not to. Everything else about the hotel was great, so in the end, they cancelled out the tiny room factor (really, how much time are you going to spend in it anyway?)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Perfecthotelsearch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Catalunya Plaza Hotel in March 2006 and it definitely lived up to the reviews I had read about it. It is just fantastic, it is central for everything, buses, aerobuses, metros and RENFE trains, shops, bars and restaurants. On arrival we were greeted by a really nice lad on reception who always went out of his way to speak to us and ask about our stay in Barcelona. Staff were excellent nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were spotless as was the dining room facilities. We have stayed in 4 star plus hotels that did not meet the match of this hotel, well done to everyone who works there!! The breakfast buffet was absolutely fantastic, I have never seen so much choice in food apart from staying at a 5 star hotel in Luxor. The choice of food was amazing and I could safely say allow yourself a good thirty to forty five minutes just to have breakfast. What I really liked was at breakfast you could have a whole pot of coffee and a pot of hot milk (not the skimping 5 star "one cup on request" nonsense that I have experienced!!) Also the complimentary coffee, tea and cava etc was just great, especially after a hard days touring about, just to go upstairs and unwind with a drink and free internet access to home-it was great-I will definitely be back. Well done again to this hotel for living up to all of its reviews!!! Mrs E Gallacher Aberdeen

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 3 nights and couldnt have asked for more. Very friendly staff in the hotel and the free internet access and refreshments just added to the personal touch. Breakfast included fresh fruit and also cooked meats and eggs and was a very good choice. I would definetely recommend a stay here and only 2 mins away from Cafe Zurich. Ask for a room with a view over Cataluna Plaza - fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: June54Uk
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a one night stay at this hotel. It's in a fabulous location, near the shops, near La Ramblas, and near the metrolinks. The staff were very helpful from check-in to check-out. A plus for me was the free internet connection in the bar/lounge enabling me to keep in contact with family (whilst enjoying a complimentary glass of wine or too). My twin room was more than adequate, exactly as shown on hotel websites, and exceptionally clean. Only drawback was that the room allocated to me (on the principal floor) must have been adjacent to the bar next door and, on a Friday night in December, there seemed to be a party going on - loud music, singing, cheering and at 2.00am the sound of chairs and tables being moved, presumable after the party ended! Having said that, I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ideal position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Catalunya Plaza for three nights 1/12-3/12 and found the ideal location for our break,it is in one of the main squares,near the terminal for the tour bus ,airport transfer bus and the famous Ramblas area. Transfer from the airport is about 20 min depending on traffic and costs 3.60euros. The tour on the bus costs 17E per day or 21E for 2 days which is good value considering that you can get on/off as many times as you want at all the variuos attractions and alternate from the BLUE route to the RED route.Dont miss Gaudys Sagrada Familia, it is breathtakingly beautiful even now and it is not finished yet(another 25 yrs)and Guell Park.Getting back to the Hotel,we followed other reviews on Trip Advisor and asked for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor and were allocated 213 and it was ideal,overlooking the Plaza , very clean and quite spacious.On the Bar/dining room floor they provided free coffee,wine,cava, cakes, sandwiches from 12noon and the breakfast was adequate.We would thoroughly recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants to visit this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: CACTeam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Catalunya Plaza Hotel for 5 nights at the end of August. This was the fourth hotel in Barcelona I had stayed in in as many years. I chose this one purely for location [and a few good reviews on this website!] and I certainly wasn't disappointed. I asked for a room overlooking the Placa Catalunya and was given Room 214 - which was perfect. Although the rooms aren't large, it was adequate for our needs and was perfectly clean. It was so lovely after a busy day's sightseeing to stand on our balcony and watch the world go by! Tourists meandered up and down the Rambla while others sat outside the many bars and cafes enjoying a drink or more with friends and family! It was a lovely holiday and the location of this hotel played a large part in making it so enjoyable! The only disappointment we found was the breakfast. There was a large choice of cakes, pastries, yoghurts, fruit as well as sausages and eggs etc. However, the eggs and sausages were almost cold on our first morning and the fresh pineapple had been out so long that it had started to go black. A little more attention to these minor points would have made it just perfect! Although this has no bearing on this hotel, a word of warning to prospective tourists to Barcelona. We saw a young girl below our balcony having her bag stolen early one morning. Although there is a larger police presence this year than I saw on previous visits, I believe the problem is getting worse and although it has been said many times before, please take extra care with your valuables and keep them with you at all times! A wonderful city for a beautiful break! Don't let anyone spoil it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the H10 Gravina we decided that we should also stay at another H10 to guarantee quality accommodation. We weren't dissapointed. The hotel is in the best location overlooking Placa catalunya (the only hotel on the square). Our room (312) overlooked the square and was spotless. I booked direct with the hotel back in January and asked for a room overlooking the square only a week before we arrived. Good points: Location Food All day drinks and free cakes/sandwiches Internet Bad points: none You will not be dissapointed with this hotel unless you get a room at the back like some others. The receptionists were polite although they didn't say much. The room service was excellent. It was very hot in barcelona so making the short walk back to the hotel to cool off was ideal and the airport bus and tourist buses are within sight of the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at this hotel for a three night city break in early June 2005. Very easy to find at the north edge of the Catylunia Plaza and easy to spot as there is a huge advertising hording with the name Opel on it. Was very impressed with the reception which looked immaculate with and impressive four floor atrium, reception booked us in quickly and offered us a glass on cava and light snacks which was a great treat. The lift is small and certainly local but works and got us to our 2nd floor rooms. All of our rooms looked out into the inner courtyard away from the square which meant no noise at all but not very interesting views. Our room, 202 was what you would expect for a city centre hotel, small but adequate, nicely furnished and very clean. the bathroom was small (we accidently broke the vase in the bathroom on the second night due to a careless towel flick) but had everything you would need. All staff including the maids were very helpful and friendly. Breakfasts were excellent, with a full range of hot / cold / cerial and even gin if you wanted it (We waited until at least 12pm until we had any alcohol ;-) )Snacks such as cake and rolls were provided on the first floor after breakfast with cava and wine free of charge. This hotel is very well located with the main shops and points of interest within minutes walking distance. Would recommend 'The Fifteen Nights' restaurant in the Placa Reial which served good food and suprisingly low prices but expect to queue as its very popular (restaurant opens at 8.30pm and by 8pm queues were lengthy). Its well worth the wait! The Hotel Oriente on the Rambla is also very good! We ate outside on the pavement area and had the best paella i have ever tasted (the Sangria was excellent too!) PS...Barcelona has the most ATM's in a city i have ever seen....not really relevent but hey!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location spotlessly clean, beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated before - Location Location Location !! We got off the Aerobus in Catalunya Plaza and this hotel is directly opposite, so a pleasant walk across the bustling plaza and we were there. We were checked in quickly and professionally and offered a glass of Cava. We were given room 211 with a lovely view of the Plaza. The room was average in size spotlessly clean with everything you could need. The breakfast was very nice with a wide variety to chose from. Don't be afraid to ask the waiters for a refill if anything runs out, they were more than happy to help. The reception staff were very pleasant and even offered to recommend nice places to eat and drink. This hotel sits at the top of La Ramblas and is central to all locations. The Bus Turistic sets off where the Aerobus dropped us off so get your ticket at the information centre ( opposite the bus stops on the Palaza) and enjoy the ride! We would definitely use this hotel again as we plan to visit this beautiful city very shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overpriced hotel - rooms small, breakfast v average. Good location. Unfortunately when we arrived hotel was over booked. We were moved to another hotel for one night and then back again - a right pain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many reports we thought we should send ours in. We visited the hotel from the 15th to 17th April. We had a wonderful time. The weather was very good, managed to get a tan in two days. And it was raining at home. We stayed in room 209, which was very small, we managed for two days, any longer would be impossible. The quality of fixtures and fittings was of a high standard. The bed was comfortable, but you could only access it from one side. A little like a bed in a caravan! The room was very clean, but don't expect to have a luxurious soak in the bath, it was very small. The welcome was friendly and efficient and we were given our glass of champagne without having to ask. The breakfast was comprehensive and service was friendly, the waiter taking time to talk to us later in the day, whilst enjoying the free wine,cava, sandwiches and cakes.Coffee and a selection of teas were also available. We enjoyed our stay but next time would request a bigger room. Barcelona itself is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: selected this hotel after reading previous reviews on this site. just to repeat what a lot of people have said already - this hotel is in an almost unbeatable location (especially, if you are heading to Barcelona for the first time and do not know your way around city yet). likewise, breakfast was excellent (we've got a very good deal - for an extra 3 euros/day we had breakfast for two...saving at least 20 euros/day if we'd have to purchase it separately at a hotel. we reserved directly via main H10 chain website). Now, from the comments here I knew to ask for the room looking over the plaza. Unfortunately, despite repeated email requests and promises 'to do our best' we were still given a room on the 4th floor, looking over some kind of ventilation shaft...(for various unrelated reasons we ended up staying there and didn't ask for a different room). Sizewise it wasn't as bad as some of the super tiny rooms other people reported about, however the elevator was noisy as hell (it doesn't actually get all the way to the 4th floor, so you have to take a couple of flights up on foot). Furnitures and bathroom fixtures were all in great (near-new) condition - no complaints there! All in all, we didn't spend that much time in the hotel outside of nights, breakfast and using the free internet in the common area. Overall, still quite above average considering we knew nothing about Barcelona before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from Barcelona. We booked this hotel through hotelsearch. But later, we found that it's a little cheaper to do this with h10. In order to avoid confusion, we decided not to swap our booking to h10. On our first day of arrival (26 March), we're given a very tiny room (Rm 201), which I think should be a single room but having a double bed jammed in. We immediately reflected our dissatifaction to the reception. But the reception told us that the hotel was full and they were unable to give an alternative one to us. However, they promised to move us to a larger room for the coming 2 days of our stay. We also read from the floor plan displayed at the back of the door that our room was the smallest on the 2nd floor. The twin rooms were also quite small but those facing the plaza were the largest. In the next morning, we were so impressed by the variety of breakfast served. It was the best one among the 3-star hotels in 10 European cities we visited. All wines were free to drink. Tapas, fresh fruits, ham, sausages, jamon, cheese, spanish tortilla, yogurt, cereal, cava, bread, croissants, ... were all included. Tea, coffee, wine, champagne and some refreshments are available after breakfast in the bar area.. Near to the bar area, there were also 2 sets of computers available 24hours and it's free of charge to get online!! When we came back in the afternoon, we found that we're allocated to a double room on the 3rd floor facing the plaza! We're so pleased with the size and the view of the room. In fact, the plaza was quite noisy but if you close the window, it's completely quiet. Note that, the air-conditioning was not switched on during winter and spring time. So, if you want to have some fresh air, you must be able to tolerate the noise from outside. The bathroom was clean with all the toiletries. The hotel is centrally located with metro stations and train stations nearby. It only takes you 5 minutes to walk to Cava Batllo and 2 more minutes to walk to Cava Mila. La Rambla is also near! We will certainly stay in the same hotel if we come back to Barcelona again, provided a room facing the plaza can be given.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of Character and Charm!”
Reviews.Author: DanOwe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Sept 2004. Most of the staff spoke english but all were very helpful regardless. The breakfast variety was outstanding. As written in previous reviews the rooms are exceptionally small, not more then 10 X 15 feet. However, with some simple improvisation it was easy to overcome. The hotel location is perfect for visiting all the major sights. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I was taking my 84 year-old mother, so we needed to be close to the tour buses, airport link etc. We could not have chosen better- everything starts in Plaza Catalunya including La Rambla The room was small- we had an ordinary one- only 7 out of 40+ are large rooms- but it was spotless, with very comfortable beds, adequate storage space and a full bathroom. A nice touch was the fresh flowers, and bottle of Cava on our first evening. It was also very quiet. The staff were helpful and courteous, and the buffet breakfast was wonderful- everything hot and cold you could imagine The bar had comfortable sittting area supplied from 11am to 11pm with tea coffee Cava red wine and also rolls and cakes- great for a quick lunch or tea when taking a rest from the city All in all an excellent hotel- I am hoping to return

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Even Better Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in August 2004 - very clean, modern hotel and the staff were very helpful and willing to advise you on the best places to go and how to get there. The location was great - the hotel is on the square right next to where La Ramblas starts, very close to the famous street but not on La Ramlas itself which can be noisy 24 hrs a day. Transport links from the hotel are excellent - the Airport bus and the tourist bus drop off and depart from Plaza Catalunya. Good value all round. Excellent buffet brekfast with a vast selection of foods. Only downfall was that the room was very small - but the location made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. Excelent location for alomost everything. The rooms where good, not to large. Breakfast was very good. Frendly staff.

HotelInfo.Name: H10 Catalunya Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza Catalunya 7, 08022 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Catalunya Plaza Hotel)
